SENT.plain: In order to reduce the subjective factor in evaluating sacroiliac joint radiographs we further evaluated changes seen on standard plain films of patients suffering from BehÃ§et's syndrome (BS) by using computed tomography (CT)
Sacroiliac joint films of 20 consecutive patients with BS were mixed with those of 20 consecutive control patients and read blindly and independently by two observers
Six patients with BS met the New York criteria for sacroiliitis
Of the control patients, one had monolateral grade 1 sacroiliitis and two revealed findings consistent with osteitis condensans ilii
CT confirmed the diagnosis of sacroiliitis in patients with BS showing a high degree in at least one joint
The results of the present study suggest that the use of CT for BS patients showing sacroiliac joint changes on pelvic plain films may limit the confusion which exists about this finding in BS
